abstract: China adopts anti-terrorism law requiring telecommunication and Internet companies to give Beijing technical information and decryption help in investigations of suspected terrorists; critics argue legislation uses expansive terrorism definition which could lead to government surveillance of non-suspects and access to technological secrets.
lead_paragraph: Opponents who had seen a draft version said it grants broad new powers that could be abused to monitor peaceful citizens and steal commercial secrets.

headline.main: China Passes Antiterrorism Law That Critics Fear May Overreach
headline.print_headline: Antiterrorism Law Expands China’s Surveillance Power

snippet: Opponents who had seen a draft version said it grants broad new powers that could be abused to monitor peaceful citizens and steal commercial secrets.
